summary:
Professor and chair at the Department of Intensive Care Medicine. 

The primary interest is fostering the quality of care of teams and their individual members taking care of patients/people.

Focus on implementing knowledge from outside the medical field, like humanities, (cognitive) psychology, and technology.

President at the Dutch Society of Intensive Care: Nederlandse Vereniging Voor Intensive Care (NVIC). 

Focus on collaboration between professionals, networks in regions, and cross-border.

Independent expert on subjects as management of crises, (ethical) decision making, collaboration for the Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sports (VWS) and the Center for Ethics and Health (CEG).

Supervisory board member at Annadal Kliniek.

Teacher and course director at the European Society of Intensive Care Medicine.

Twitter: @iccvanderhorst @cht_ic

profile_positions.description:
As the Medical Director, together with the Business Director, I am leading a dedicated staff team. The Center for Acute and Critical Care is a hub of dedicated professionals who specialize in treating acute patients. Our team is highly trained and experienced in providing top-notch care for individuals facing urgent medical needs.

Within our center, we house a range of specialized departments including Intensive Care, Medium Care, Cardiac Care Unit, Emergency Department, Acute Admission Unit (AOA), and Recovery. By working collaboratively and seamlessly, we ensure the efficient coordination of care for acute and critically ill patients.

Member of the portfolio committee.

Member of the finance selection committee.

profile_positions.description:
Currently I am the president of the Society. Previously I was the treasurer. As president I lead the board and am responsible for the fruitful collaboration. Together we created a vission for the upcoming years. Our mission is to make our vision work.

The Dutch Society for Intensive Care (NVIC) is an association for intensivists and doctors with an interest in intensive care medicine. The association was founded in 1977 and currently has over 900 members.

The association has usual members (GIC recognized intensivists) and IC fellow members (those who are training to become intensivists). It also has extraordinary members (doctors and other professionals with an interest in Intensive Care Medicine).

De Nederlandse Vereniging voor Intensive Care (NVIC) is een vereniging voor intensivisten en artsen met belangstelling voor intensive care geneeskunde. De vereniging is opgericht in 1977 en telt momenteel ruim 900 leden.

De vereniging kent gewone leden (GIC erkende intensivisten) en IC-fellow leden (zij die in opleiding zijn tot intensivist). Daarnaast kent zij buitengewone leden (artsen en andere professionals met belangstelling voor Intensive Care Geneeskunde).

profile_positions.description:
I was the principal investigator of the Simple Intensive Care Studies (SICS). In this ongoing registry, we included up to 2000 patients to unravel the diagnostic and prognostic value of physical and physiological examination. Based on the variables included, physicians make clinical decisions in the sickest patients every day. The design paper is published in the BMJ Open.

I was a leading investigator of clinical studies on critically ill patients. We were focussing on hemodynamics, the heart in non-cardiac disease, acute kidney failure at the ICU. Our team was involved in initiatives that combine the best of a prospective cohort study (like SICS-I, SOCCS and SICS-II) and randomised controlled trial design. The protocols were based upon results of systematic reviews (see Prospero).

I was also a co-primary investigator in clinical studies on myocardial infarction and heart failure, especially about (glucose) metabolism. Like the Metformin to Reduce Heart Failure After Myocardial Infarction (GIPS-III), NCT01217307. With this study, we obtained a grant of the Netherlands Organization for Health Research and Development (ZonMW; project no. 40-41200-98-9139). Over 20 publications out of this structured study have been published.

Therefore, I was an investigator in the  Glucose Insulin Potassium Study (GIPS) I and II, both supported by the Netherlands Heart Foundation (99.028 and 2003B277). Studies on the diagnostic and prognostic value of routine laboratory measures in critically ill patients. Implementation study on secondary prevention.

profile_positions.description:
The first 3 months at the Department of Anesthesiology I was trained in airway management, arterial and venous access with echography, and (non-) invasive hemodynamic monitoring. Successfully passed the internal exam (green light) which allows you to start up singly.

Thereafter worked for 3 months at the Neuro Intensive Care Unit (ICU). Continued improving skills like vascular access, echography and ultrafiltration. At the Surgical ICU taking care of patients after higher risk surgery. During the 3 months at the Internal ICU I was trained in supervision and focussend on acute and chronic airway management. At the Thoracic ICU worked for 6 months with mechanical circulatory support and supervised the ward. A second period at the Neuro ICU improving skills in neurologic diagnostics and scoring systems. Currently back at Surgical ICU.

Teacher on echocardiography (UMCG), basic course Intensive Care (UMCG), basic airwaymanagement (NVIC).
